gui

Class GUI

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Frame
            • javax.swing.JFrame
              • gui.GUI
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants

    public class GUI
extends javax.swing.JFrame
    Graphical user interface of program. "author Antti Kurronen
    See Also:

      Opens a message dialog.

      Starts the precounting, opens a progress bar and calculates the cell positions.

      If cell picking thread is not running this method starts it.

      Updates properties (color, size thickness, etc.) of all MarkingPanels.

      Updates the coordinates of markings of selected MarkingPanel.

      Updates the coordinates of markings in MarkingPanels by calculating the points at image to the points at screen.
      void updateGridPanel()
      Refreshes GridPanel if selected MarkingLayer has Grid set as visible.

      Highlights a single marking if found close the Point p.

      Refreshes the Info Panel at right of main GUI where information of LAYERS are shown.

      Updates properties (color, size thickness, etc.) of MarkingPanel, which id is given.
      void zoomAndUpdateImage(java.awt.Point midPoint, double zoomValue, int processinID)
      Organizes the zooming of image in or out to given point and given zoom multiplier.

      • isAllowedImageDimension

        public boolean isAllowedImageDimension(java.io.File file)
                                throws java.lang.Exception
        Checks that given image file dimension is same as the dimension of previously used images. ONLY ONE IMAGE DIMENSION IS ALLOWED.
        Parameters:
        file - File image file which size is determined
        Returns:
        boolean true if allowed dimension. Otherwise false.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - the exception

      • manageImageLayersAndMarkings

        public void manageImageLayersAndMarkings()
        Starts the progress to add ImageLayers or import MarkingLayers to ImageLayers if any ImageLayer present: User gives the image and/or markings from file in new Dialog window. ImageLayer(s) are created or updated and when done, GUI layers, ImagePanel and ImageLayerInfo is updated

      • openAddImageLayerDialog

        public void openAddImageLayerDialog(java.io.File[] fileList)
        Starts the progress to add one ImageLayer: User gives the image and possible markings from file in new Dialog window. ImageLayer(s) are created and when done, GUI layers, ImagePanel and ImageLayerInfo is updated
        Parameters:
        fileList - the list of files

      • paintLayers

        public void paintLayers()

        java.lang.Exception

      • removeImageLayer

        public void removeImageLayer(int layerID,
                             java.lang.String layerName)
        Removes the ImageLayer from list of ImageLayers at informationCenter. Removes also the MarkingPanels corresponding to MarkingLayers of removed ImageLayer.Confirm dialog is shown to confirm removing.
        Parameters:
        layerID - int ID of ImageLayer, which is removed.
        layerName - String name of ImageLayer.

      • removeMarkingLayer

        public void removeMarkingLayer(int imageLayerID,
                               int mLayerID,
                               java.lang.String markingLayerName)
        Removes the MarkingLayer and corresponding MarkingPanel by given MarkingLayer ID. Confirm dialog will be shown. ImageLayerInfo will be updated.
        Parameters:
        imageLayerID - int ID of ImageLayer which MarkingLayer is removed.
        mLayerID - int ID of MarkingLayer, which is removed .
        markingLayerName - the marking layer name

      • removeSingleMarking

        public boolean removeSingleMarking(java.awt.Point p)
                            throws java.lang.Exception
        Removes a single marking closest to Point p. If no any marking found close enough, no any removed.
        Parameters:
        p - Point at screen where right mouse button was pressed
        Returns:
        boolean true if marking was removed; otherwise false
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - the exception

      • setSelectedImageLayerAndImage

        public void setSelectedImageLayerAndImage(int iLayerID,
                                          int selectionChangeType)
        Updates the InformationCenter and LayerVisualManager for which ImageLayer is selected and which BufferedImage object is in LayerVisualManger. Method updates the ImagePanel of GUI. This method is called always when selected (visible) ImageLayer is changed by user. If ImageLayer is already selected is the visibility of MarkingLayers changed if this method is called by eye-icon.
        Parameters:
        iLayerID - ID of ImageLayer that will be the selected ImageLayer (visible)
        selectionChangeType - the selection change type

                             throws java.lang.Exception

        java.lang.Exception - the exception

                              int size)
                       throws java.lang.Exception

        size - Size of picked cell
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - the exception

      • startStopCellPicking

        public void startStopCellPicking()
        If cell picking thread is not running this method starts it. If the selected MarkingLayer contains markings, will a dialog confirm overwriting them. Sets glassPane visible and shows the cell selecting rectangle and round over the image. If cell picking was already running it will be stopped.

      • zoomAndUpdateImage

        public void zoomAndUpdateImage(java.awt.Point midPoint,
                               double zoomValue,
                               int processinID)
                        throws java.lang.Exception
        Organizes the zooming of image in or out to given point and given zoom multiplier. Determines and refreshes also the markings, grid and highlight.
        Parameters:
        midPoint - Point where zooming will focus
        zoomValue - double multiplier how much is zoomed (1.25 corresponds to 25% zoom)
        processinID - int ID quality of Image (ID.IMAGE_PROCESSING_BEST_QUALITY, etc.)
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - the exception
